title: Polynesian Words in English
description: From taboo to tattoo, explore the Polynesian language roots behind some fascinating English words!

questions.question: The word 'taboo' comes from the Tongan 'tabu.' What does 'tabu' mean?
Which English word for permanent body ink comes from the Tahitian 'tatau'?
Who brought the word 'tattoo' to the English-speaking world after his Pacific voyages?
The word 'wiki' (as in Wikipedia) comes from Hawaiian. What does 'wiki' mean?
Which English word for a type of skirt made from grass or plant fibers is associated with Polynesian culture?
The word 'mana' from Polynesian languages is used in English. What does it refer to?
Which Hawaiian word meaning 'love, affection, or compassion' is widely used in English?
The word 'ukulele' comes from Hawaiian. What does 'ukulele' literally mean?
Which Polynesian-derived word describes a large stone statue, particularly those found on Easter Island?
The word 'tiki' comes from Polynesian mythology. What does a tiki typically represent?
options: The first human or a carved humanoid figure

questions.question: Which Polynesian word for a traditional feast has been adopted into English, especially in Hawaiian contexts?
The Maori word 'kiwi' is used in English for both a bird and a fruit. What does the kiwi bird symbolize in New Zealand?
options: National identity (it is the national bird)

questions.question: Which Samoan word for a wrap-around garment is used in English?
The Maori word 'haka' is internationally known. What is a haka?
options: A ceremonial war dance with chanting

questions.question: Which Hawaiian word meaning 'family' (including extended family) has become widely used in English?
